summary: This document is an email chain from November 2021 between a Deputy United States Marshal from the Protective Intelligence Unit (SDNY) and an FBI Special Agent regarding security preparations for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The discussion includes coordinating contact information for case agents and investigating a reported threat from an individual in the courtroom.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office, Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit, corresponding with a Deputy U.S. Marshal about Maxwell trial security and case agent contacts.

persons.name: Deputy United States Marshal
persons.context: Deputy U.S. Marshal from the Protective Intelligence Unit, Southern District of New York, coordinating security intelligence and contact information for the upcoming Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Detective
persons.context: Detective listed as a case agent, along with an FBI Special Agent, for the Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the upcoming trial, referenced in the context of security preparations and passport possession.

connections.description: Corresponding about security coordination and information sharing for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.
Listed as case agents working together on the Maxwell trial.
The Marshal's unit is responsible for courthouse security and transport for Maxwell's trial.

events.title: Email Coordination on Maxwell Trial Threat
events.description: Email discussion regarding an FBI agent dropping off information about an individual making threats in the courtroom, prompting a request for the point of contact.

events.title: Initial Security Prep Inquiry
events.description: Deputy U.S. Marshal requests contact information for FBI case agents and information on possession of Maxwell's passports for trial security briefing.

keyFacts: The U.S. Marshals Service was preparing security for Ghislaine Maxwell's trial in late 2021, seeking direct contacts with FBI case agents.
An incident was reported where an FBI agent dropped off information about an individual making threats in the courtroom, but did not leave contact details.
The FBI confirmed it was not in possession of Ghislaine Maxwell's passports as of October 2021.
The email chain highlights inter-agency coordination (FBI and USMS) for high-profile trial security.
